abstract.p: Toronto Blue Jays pitcher David Wells says he plans to call David Cone to give struggling New York Yankees pitcher pep talk (S)

block.p: David Wells of the Blue Jays said that he plans to give David Cone a call before the second half of the season to give the struggling Yankee pitcher a pep talk. Wells, the Toronto left-hander, who pitched two scoreless innings as the American League starter tonight, said that he had already tried to call Cone but had not had any success reaching him.

''He's never been through anything like this before,'' said Wells (15-2), who was a teammate of Cone's in New York in 1997 and 1998. ''It can get to you mentally. He's 37 years old and people are questioning him.''

''I've seen him do it for so long,'' Wells said. ''He's still got something left.''
